content:
Diagnosis:
T2N0 squamous cell carcinoma of nasal cavity

Previous treatment:
Wide local excision March 2024
Adjuvant radiotherapy completed May 2024 - 60Gy in 30 fractions

Current medications:
Regular paracetamol
Saline nasal douching

Current situation:
Routine surveillance review

I reviewed [redacted name] in follow up clinic today. He has completed his adjuvant radiotherapy 8 weeks ago and is recovering well from the expected side effects. The acute radiation dermatitis has now resolved. He reports ongoing mild nasal dryness which is improving with regular saline douching. His taste sensation is gradually returning to normal. No new concerning symptoms.

On examination today, the nasal cavity shows expected post-treatment changes with good healing. No evidence of recurrent or residual disease. The neck remains clear with no palpable lymphadenopathy.

Plan is for ongoing regular surveillance. Next review in 3 months with nasendoscopy.

patient_facts.value: Mild nasal dryness improving with saline douching
Nasal cavity shows expected post-treatment changes with good healing, no evidence of recurrent disease
Neck clear with no palpable lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: T2N0 nasal cavity SCC treated with surgery and adjuvant radiotherapy. Recovering well from treatment with no evidence of recurrence.
Resolved radiation dermatitis, improving nasal dryness and taste changes
